answers.author: Toby Cotter
answers.text:
The municipality should carry a credit card. No matter the size, I would suggest a credit card be held for emergency purchases and necessary uses such as web hosting. It is hard to think that any community could survive without a website and credit card in 2014.

author: Matthew Wolf
text:
Is the general practice that municipalities have credit cards so they can make on-line purchases? I am working with a small village to develop a website but without a credit card/debit card they have no way of making hosting purchases for the website.
I guess the question is how have municipalities handled this in the past and specifically how have municipalities registered/signed-up for credit cards in the past?
Thanks
title: Municipal Credit Cards
